intro: Charlwoodia spectabilis, commonly known as the showy charlwoodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
